name: GamePlayMode
description: Indicates whether this game is multi-player, co-op or single-player.
title: GamePlayMode

___description.description: A short description of the item.
___description.title: description

___potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.
___potentialAction.title: potentialAction

image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.
image.title: image

agent.description: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). e.g. *John* wrote a book.
agent.title: agent

description.description: A short description of the item.
description.title: description

instrument.description: The object that helped the agent perform the action. e.g. John wrote a book with *a pen*.
instrument.title: instrument

error.description: For failed actions, more information on the cause of the failure.
error.title: error

participant.description: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with *Steve*.
participant.title: participant

target.description: Indicates a target EntryPoint for an Action.
target.title: target

result.description: The result produced in the action. e.g. John wrote *a book*.
result.title: result

additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.
additionalType.title: additionalType

actionStatus.description: Indicates the current disposition of the Action.
actionStatus.title: actionStatus

potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.
potentialAction.title: potentialAction

startTime.description:
The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December.

Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.
startTime.title: startTime

location.description: The location of the event, organization or action.
location.title: location

endTime.description:
The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*.

Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.
endTime.title: endTime

sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
sameAs.title: sameAs

object.description: The object upon the action is carried out, whose state is kept intact or changed. Also known as the semantic roles patient, affected or undergoer (which change their state) or theme (which doesn't). e.g. John read *a book*.
object.title: object

___additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.
___additionalType.title: additionalType

___image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.
___image.title: image

embedUrl.description: A URL pointing to a player for a specific video. In general, this is the information in the src element of an embed tag and should not be the same as the content of the loc tag. (previous spelling: embedURL)
embedUrl.title: embedUrl

typicalAgeRange.description: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.
typicalAgeRange.title: typicalAgeRange

workExample.description: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. eg. The paperback edition, first edition, or eBook. Inverse property: exampleOfWork.
workExample.title: workExample

keywords.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.
keywords.title: keywords

isFamilyFriendly.description: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.
isFamilyFriendly.title: isFamilyFriendly

about.description: The subject matter of the content.
about.title: about

bitrate.description: The bitrate of the media object.
bitrate.title: bitrate

associatedArticle.description: A NewsArticle associated with the Media Object.
associatedArticle.title: associatedArticle

character.description: Fictional person connected with a creative work.
character.title: character

copyrightHolder.description: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.
copyrightHolder.title: copyrightHolder

review.description: A review of the item. Supersedes reviews.
review.title: review

publication.description: A publication event associated with the episode, clip or media object.
publication.title: publication

text.description: The textual content of this CreativeWork.
text.title: text

accessibilityControl.description: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).
accessibilityControl.title: accessibilityControl

height.description: The height of the item or person.
height.title: height

educationalUse.description: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.
educationalUse.title: educationalUse

regionsAllowed.description: The regions where the media is allowed. If not specified, then it's assumed to be allowed everywhere. Specify the countries in ISO 3166 format.
regionsAllowed.title: regionsAllowed

offers.description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, or give away tickets to an event.
offers.title: offers

image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.
image.title: image

audience.description: The intended audience of the item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.
audience.title: audience

thumbnail.description: Thumbnail image for an image or video.
thumbnail.title: thumbnail

discussionUrl.description: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.
discussionUrl.title: discussionUrl

hasPart.description: Indicates a CreativeWork that is (in some sense) a part of this CreativeWork. Inverse property: isPartOf.
hasPart.title: hasPart

author.description: The author of this content. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.
author.title: author

inLanguage.description: The language of the content. please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard.
inLanguage.title: inLanguage

productionCompany.description: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.
productionCompany.title: productionCompany

releasedEvent.description: The place and time the release was issued, expressed as a PublicationEvent.
releasedEvent.title: releasedEvent

exampleOfWork.description: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of. Inverse property: workExample.
exampleOfWork.title: exampleOfWork

encoding.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia. Supersedes encodings.
encoding.title: encoding

isPartOf.description: Indicates a CreativeWork that this CreativeWork is (in some sense) part of. Inverse property: hasPart.
isPartOf.title: isPartOf

version.description: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.
version.title: version

commentCount.description: The number of comments this CreativeWork (e.g. Article, Question or Answer) has received. This is most applicable to works published in Web sites with commenting system; additional comments may exist elsewhere.
commentCount.title: commentCount

encodesCreativeWork.description: The CreativeWork encoded by this media object.
encodesCreativeWork.title: encodesCreativeWork

publishingPrinciples.description: Link to page describing the editorial principles of the organization primarily responsible for the creation of the CreativeWork.
publishingPrinciples.title: publishingPrinciples

license.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.
license.title: license

requiresSubscription.description: Indicates if use of the media require a subscription  (either paid or free). Allowed values are true or false (note that an earlier version had 'yes', 'no').
requiresSubscription.title: requiresSubscription

uploadDate.description: Date when this media object was uploaded to this site.
uploadDate.title: uploadDate

mentions.description: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.
mentions.title: mentions

potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.
potentialAction.title: potentialAction

publisher.description: The publisher of the creative work.
publisher.title: publisher

producer.description: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).
producer.title: producer

contentRating.description: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.
contentRating.title: contentRating

position.description: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.
position.title: position

expires.description: Date the content expires and is no longer useful or available. Useful for videos.
expires.title: expires

isBasedOnUrl.description: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html
isBasedOnUrl.title: isBasedOnUrl

translator.description: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market.
translator.title: translator

description.description: A short description of the item.
description.title: description

accessibilityHazard.description: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3. (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values)
accessibilityHazard.title: accessibilityHazard

duration.description: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.
duration.title: duration

contributor.description: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork.
contributor.title: contributor

award.description: An award won by this person or for this creative work. Supersedes awards.
award.title: award

dateCreated.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was created.
dateCreated.title: dateCreated

provider.description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller. Supersedes carrier.
provider.title: provider

recordedAt.description: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event. Inverse property: recordedIn.
recordedAt.title: recordedAt

copyrightYear.description: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.
copyrightYear.title: copyrightYear

accessibilityFeature.description: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).
accessibilityFeature.title: accessibilityFeature

educationalAlignment.description: An alignment to an established educational framework.
educationalAlignment.title: educationalAlignment

playerType.description: Player type required—for example, Flash or Silverlight.
playerType.title: playerType

genre.description: Genre of the creative work or group.
genre.title: genre

accessibilityAPI.description: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).
accessibilityAPI.title: accessibilityAPI

learningResourceType.description: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.
learningResourceType.title: learningResourceType

interactionCount.description: A count of a specific user interactions with this item—for example, 20 UserLikes, 5 UserComments, or 300 UserDownloads. The user interaction type should be one of the sub types of UserInteraction.
interactionCount.title: interactionCount

representativeOfPage.description: Indicates whether this image is representative of the content of the page.
representativeOfPage.title: representativeOfPage

thumbnailUrl.description: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.
thumbnailUrl.title: thumbnailUrl

editor.description: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.
editor.title: editor

creator.description: The creator/author of this CreativeWork or UserComments. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.
creator.title: creator

citation.description: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.
citation.title: citation

dateModified.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified.
dateModified.title: dateModified

associatedMedia.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.
associatedMedia.title: associatedMedia

alternativeHeadline.description: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.
alternativeHeadline.title: alternativeHeadline

timeRequired.description: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'P30M', 'P1H25M'.
timeRequired.title: timeRequired

interactivityType.description: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.
interactivityType.title: interactivityType

contentUrl.description: Actual bytes of the media object, for example the image file or video file. (previous spelling: contentURL)
contentUrl.title: contentUrl

additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.
additionalType.title: additionalType

sourceOrganization.description: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.
sourceOrganization.title: sourceOrganization

accountablePerson.description: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.
accountablePerson.title: accountablePerson

comment.description: Comments, typically from users, on this CreativeWork.
comment.title: comment

aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.
aggregateRating.title: aggregateRating

sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
sameAs.title: sameAs

___sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
___sameAs.title: sameAs
